Write a positive review about a good electronic device: iphone6s  This is a great smartphone for its price range, however if you want the best quality this phone is definitely not for you. The device itself is not bad, but there are some quality issues. The phone is very small for its size. The screen is pretty dim which makes for a dark screen. The buttons are not the best either, the fingerprint sensor is just a little too sensitive, but it is a very small flaw in a good phone. The battery life is also mediocre, I get about 3 days of usage from the 16gb of internal memory. However the device is quite light weight which is great, but the battery does get very hot. The camera is ok, the only problem with it is that the flash is a little hard to focus. All in all this is a good smartphone for the money, but if you are a camera junkie you might not like this phone.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ive been using the msm621 and i really like it. Its the only one i've tried that can actually be used in a "real" environment. ive used it in my office, on the road, in a car, at a friend's house, etc. i'm able to get it to work on my iphone 6, which is pretty awesome. i can't recommend this enough.   i did have a small problem, but it was a very easy fix. i bought the micro usb cable and connected the mcs to the usb cable that came with the device. this is not a good idea, as it may cause the phone to go into a "panic" mode, i dont know if this is a problem that can be fixed or just my device. i have also read that if you use a usb cable on the back of the phone, you may also get a small electrical problem.   The device is very easy to use and very simple to setup. I am using it on my iPhone 6. I have never had a problem using the phone.  , but i can see why people might have a problem with the price for a device like this. it is a little more than a typical phone charger, and if you get one that has the usb port on the side of it, the msl621 may not work for you.
Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    My only issue is that it's a little hard to use. The buttons are just a little harder to press than they should be. You have to use both hands to press them, and it's not a pleasant task. It's the type of thing that could be fixed with a little design tweak, but it's really not worth the hassle. I was hoping for a more ergonomic, easier to use keyboard. I do really like the idea of the backlight though.  I really like this keyboard, although the keycaps feel a bit too soft for my tastes. I bought this to replace my laptop's old, old, dead, slow keyboard. This keyboard is awesome! The keys are super firm and the spacing between keys is great. The only complaint I have is the backlighting. It only works with the brightness on "high". I think that the light on this keyboard needs to be on "low" instead of "high" to work properly. It would be nice if the light would come on when the keyboard is turned off as well.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I've only owned the Korg KX3, but have heard great things about the KX7. The sound is not the best on the K3, and is somewhat flat in comparison, but the K7 is so much better in so many ways. The K7 sounds much fuller than the Kx3 and has more detail. The bass has much more impact and a great punch. The highs have more presence and more air to them. The mids have more air as well. The instruments are not as bright on the X3 but the difference in sound is noticeable. The only issue I've found with the K X7 is that the buttons are somewhat difficult to press and are sometimes hard to hit. I also noticed that the volume knob is slightly too close to the power button. Also, it can take a few tries to get the controls to work the way they should. Overall I love the K-X7 and am glad to have it in my arsenal. The price is also quite good and I am very happy with my purchase.

I replaced the screen, power adapter and hard drive about a year ago.   The Dell is the best laptop I've ever owned. I have to admit, I was a little concerned when I purchased it, as I was concerned about how well the battery would hold up. I did notice a slight decline in the battery life in the weeks following the replacement, but it's only been a week and a half and it seems to be holding up great.   a month ago I replaced all my cables and a year later the battery is still working. I've had to charge it a few times during the week. The laptop is not heavy and I can use it while I'm out and about, it just needs to be charged more frequently than the other two laptops I own.   The screen is nice and bright. I like how the screen is adjustable from the back. I think a screen this size is nice for when you have a smaller laptop.     One thing I have noticed that bothers me is the lack of speakers in the keyboard. When I use a laptop, I can always hear the fans when they're working. The speakers on this laptop are not loud enough.   "I really love this product. It's easy to use, great quality, and has great features. Only good for a little more than an hour of use.  Review: This laptop is great. I love the keyboard, the trackpad is awesome, and there is just so much you can do with it. However, it comes with a single AAA battery that will die in about 5 hours. This means that unless you are really out and want to have your laptop go from zero to 100 in about 3 hours, you will be out of juice by the time you get home. If you are using this laptop for work, it's a great option. If not, you are better off spending $500 on a better battery.  "I just love this computer. Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- This is a great little amp! I was looking for a way to get my guitar or bass into a more digital world. I got the Blue version, and it's a great sounding unit. The only thing that I wish they could have included with the Blue was a cable with a 1/4" plug in the middle, instead of a straight one, but that's a minor gripe. Also, if you want to use it as a preamp, get a stereo amp that's not a "single-ended" or "single ended" preamp. This one is a single-ended preamp; I use the Blue to preamp my guitar. It does a great job with my preamp too. Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase! I will be buying more of these.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   I bought this device after having my Sonos Playbar for a year. I used to have the Sonos player, but the buttons and control scheme were too similar to my Sonotube. This is the first time I have used a Sonos. The controls are very responsive, especially if you are used to using the Sonotubes. The sound is crisp and clean. I use it with my old Sony CD player, and it sounds good. The volume control is a little confusing because the buttons are in a different position, but once you get the hang of it you can easily use the controls to change volume. Overall a great device, but I'm just a newbie.

I have not tried the speakers, but so far they seem good. The software is a bit confusing but it seems to work. -Jim  From the reviews of the LG G3 and G3+, I expected this monitor to have a few more advantages over the LGs. This monitor has the same features and performance of the G3, but has the added feature of HDMI and DisplayPort inputs. While I haven't had a chance to use it with my G3+ yet, I'm pretty excited to see if it's a good upgrade. It would be nice if the stand came with a few different mounting options, but I'm not too concerned about that. The quality of the screen is great, and the audio on this monitor is just as good as the LG's. The only thing that would make this monitor even better would be if the video quality on this was at least a little bit better. The LG monitor is the first monitor I've owned that I can say "I like." It's bright and beautiful, but the audio is just fine. It will be nice to see an option for a better audio connection in the future, but as is, I'll be keeping the G4 and G4+ on my desk. Here's the back of the monitor.

It doesn't take up much space and has a great battery life. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is that it does not work as well with a wireless keyboard as it does with a wired one. However, the quality is good and this is a great purchase. I am very happy with this purchase.  Great product, but... The product itself is very nice, and I'm sure it will last a while. The issue with it is that if you want to connect to a wireless mouse/keyboard, you need to connect both at once, otherwise it won't recognize them as one device. Also, the screen is small, and it's hard to read at full size. I bought this for my wife, who is a very active gamer. The small size is a good thing for her, but it would be great if it could handle her bigger gamepad. Overall, I would recommend this product, if you are interested in wireless gaming, but would want to purchase two at a time to use one with your wireless keyboard and mouse.  for gaming, you can buy a keyboard with a bluetooth controller, but this does not do anything for me. I'm using this for casual gaming and using the bluetooth keyboard is very awkward, and this thing doesn't work as good as the wired keyboard. The product seems like a good product for the price, but I can't really recommend it.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I am really enjoying the XM-L2 headphones. They are very comfortable, have a nice bass response, and sound great. I use them on the go and have been using them daily for about two months. The only drawback is that there is a small but noticeable gap between the earpads and the earphones, and sometimes a little bit of bleed from the earphone itself. If this was fixed the headphones would be perfect, but as is the headphones are worth every penny. They're very portable, comfortable and easy to use. Definitely recommend this product. I have used the XMs for a few weeks now, and I am very pleased with them. I had tried a couple of headphones from different brands, but they just never sounded right to me. The sound quality of the Xs was just what I was looking for. I can't speak on the durability or build quality, but I can say they are very good for the price. They also come with a carrying case that's good for travel, and the price is really very good. I will buy them again if I need to.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    I bought the new MacBook Air. It's the only MacBook Air I bought. It has the same quality as the old ones. I really like the new touchpad. I have the retina display and it's much sharper. I can't really tell that the old one is a Retina Display from just looking at it. The batteries lasted a very long time. The touchpad is much better. I was a little disappointed that there was no back light. I would like it to have back light, it's very bright when it's on. The speakers are a little quiet. I'm not sure what the issue is. I like the keyboard and I really don't think there is any need to buy a mechanical keyboard with a touchpad on it. It would have been nice if there was an option for a mechanical option. The keyboard is good. I just wish it had back light or a back light option on the keyboard. I've had a few mechanical keyboards and it is much easier to type on a mechanical one.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I bought the Sennheiser HD598. I'm really impressed with the quality of this headset. It has a lot of options to choose from, but I've got it because I've heard people talk about the S6. I don't have much experience with the S series, but my expectations were pretty high. The HD598 is a lot more portable than the S5, and has the best quality I've ever heard in a headset, from the sound to the feel. The S6 just isn't even in the same league. The sound quality is just too low for me. I had to turn the volume up to hear myself talk, which was a major pain. I would say the S60 is slightly better, but the HD598 has it beat in every way.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: iphone. The battery life is very good, and you have a choice of two screen sizes (if you want the large one, you will have to pay more for a pro one). It also comes with a very handy stand which you can attach to your wall to save space. It has a few cool features such as an internal speaker that doubles as a microphone. The camera is good enough for a camera that doesn't require you to take pictures to get good photos. It's a good camera for those that want to take photos but don't want to spend a lot on a camera. I have had no problems with the camera. The only thing I wish it had was an SD card slot. I can use the card in a memory card reader and the camera can take the photos off of the card.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   I've been wanting an analog to digital converter for a long time. I wanted a device that I could plug into the wall, and play music from my computer on my portable CD player. This is it! I love the simplicity of this unit, the ability to play back audio files and adjust volume is awesome, and the included cord makes the whole thing feel like a little portable unit. My only gripe is that the included speaker is pretty much the same as the old one I used for years. I've heard people complain about how low quality the speakers are, and they are. However, it's a little annoying that they have to buy the speakers separately, and I don't want to use my crappy speakers. If I'm going to use it on the go, I don`t mind paying a little extra for a good quality one.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   I bought this for my daughter as a Christmas present, and she loved it. I had never used a computer before, but I'm a total geek, so I wasn't worried about what it would do. The screen was a little hard to read at first, but once you got used to it, it was really easy to use. The graphics were clear and sharp, and it was very easy to learn the ins and outs of the computer. The only thing I would change is that it was a lot of effort to turn the computer off and on. The power button is hard to find, and you have to be careful because you don't want it to turn on accidentally, or on a table where it can be knocked over. Other than that, I would recommend this to any gamer, especially the younger ones. It's just so cool to play games on.
Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  The new M-Series was the first I've bought from C.H. for some time, and they have a good reputation, and the sound is very nice. I used the EHX Super-Vibe in the last couple of years with no issues, and this unit is a bit bigger and a bit louder than the EHP. The M-series sounds just as good, if not better. Good, but could be better:   This is a good unit, but there are a couple things I'd like to see in the future. I like the fact that it comes with a 3-band EQ, but the volume knob is a little small and doesn't work well with the other knobs. The tone knob is small and a little difficult to use, as you have to turn it in the opposite direction of the volume controls, which means you have no access to the full tone range (it's not that big a deal, I just prefer the way it works). There's a neat little feature where you can use a small rubberized strip on the back of the unit to remove the foam padding on the front of the units. It helps the unit feel a little more like a real amp. This is an easy to use product, but it's missing a few features that I'd really like to have.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ------------ I've had my Sennheiser PC-1 for a couple months now. I use it for gaming, music, and general listening. It's just good enough that I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good, but not amazing headphone. The only problem I have had is that the cable is not that flexible and gets in the way sometimes. Other than that, I really like this headphone. It sounds great and is extremely comfortable.  Style of Music: --------------- Well, this is a pretty nice looking headphone. I like that it looks like a typical, well built headphone. When I first opened it, I was not sure if it was going to be any good. I went through about 5 pairs before I realized it was made of a plastic that is kind of brittle, but if you use a rubber band, it's fine. I used a nice rubber band to keep the headband in place. This headphone is a bit larger than my previous headphones, and the cable can be hard to keep in place at times, but it works just fine. Overall, I would say this is better than my old Senns. I think it is just because my last headphones had a very small, stiff, plastic headband. But this one is a different story. The build quality is decent, but the headbands are not that comfortable. I would definitely recommend getting some sort of padding. Pairing: ------------- The cable has a 1/8" connector and a 1.5 meter cable, so I was pretty sure that this would work with any computer or mp3 player. The plug is a standard 1/4" plug, but I had no issues with the sound quality. The ear cup is removable and comes with a velour cloth. I did not try to insert the velour, but they seemed pretty comfortable. Overall I am happy with this pair, and I think that Senn would be able to sell them very easily. The velour is a nice touch.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   Very nice, but if you are thinking of getting one just for the audio, don't. I am a music enthusiast and was very excited about this device. I have a Sennheiser MKE 600 with a 3-pin XLR plug and I was so excited to find out that it also had a headphone jack. I didn't realize that the jack was permanently attached to the cable and the connector on the other end of the cable is not a standard 3-conductor. I've been very disappointed in this, since the MKE 6x6 is a much better device for audio than the MEElectronics 3-Conductor Cable. I haven't had any problems with the audio quality. I don't use it much, but it works great for the simple things like watching DVDs or playing a game. I highly recommend this device, but I think the audio jack on the cable was made for a different purpose. I'm still very pleased with my purchase.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    Great device, but has a few things going for it that might be missed by some. I have an iPad 4 that is getting close to the end of its life. I use the Apple Remote app a lot to control my home theater setup. My iPad has a touch screen and the remote is very handy to use. I also have an Apple TV, which is not a great experience. I prefer to use the remote app because it's easier to use, and the interface is simple. However, the touch screen is a pain in the butt to use on a television, and I'm not a big fan of the remote on the Apple TV.   The Apple Watch is also very handy and a nice way to control some of my other devices. I'm using it as a second monitor on my desk and use the smart features of the Apple Watch. I was hoping that the Apple AirPods would be able to pair to my Apple Watch, but it seems that it can't. If it can pair to the Apple Music service, I will be very happy. I think that Apple needs to focus on making their products easier to work with.   a bit of a bummer is that the watch is very limited when it comes to being a full smartwatch. The watch can not be paired to an iPhone and only has a small amount of connectivity. It's also very limited in its application. For example, it can not control a computer. You have to download the AirPod app for that. There is also no way to use Siri or any other smart features. That said, the watch has many benefits that are worth buying.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I was very excited about the new S5 from Samsung. It's nice to have a smaller phone that still can do most of the things a larger phone can do. However, my main issue is that the phone isn't as well-designed as it should be. It seems as if Samsung's design team doesn't care that a smaller device is actually a larger device with the screen, buttons and grip being the same. The phone also doesn't feel as solid as a larger smartphone. For example, when I take the S5 out of the box, it seems to have less weight to it than the iPhone 6s or the Nexus 6P. The S5 does have a few good things though. For one, the phone feels very sturdy. It doesn't bend easily and the phone's back has a good grip. There are no sharp edges that will break off or cause a lot of damage to your phone. The only negative thing I have is the camera. When it comes to selfies, I have a hard time taking good pictures in low light. The front-facing camera also doesn´t perform as well as a lot other high-end phones. It can't produce high quality pictures and you'll have a harder time getting the shot when your hands are shaking. Overall, the S4 Active feels like a good smartphone but Samsung should make some changes to improve it. If you can't live with a smaller smartphone, the iPhone is the best choice. If it's a matter of convenience, the Nexus line is still the best. Verified purchase: Yes | Condition: New

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    I bought a Sony KDL-55E6100 to replace my old one that I had for 20 years. It worked fine, was easy to use, the sound was great, the colors were amazing, I love my new Sony, the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that I'm very disappointed that Sony made it so difficult to change the firmware. Sony made a big deal about how they will never use firmware to make their devices better but this is the most frustrating thing I've ever bought a product from. I tried to change my firmware using the Sony website but I had to reset my device by taking the unit apart, connecting the USB cable to the USB port on the motherboard and then reconnecting the cable to a computer to update the firmware and then I have to download a new firmware to my computer and then connect the new firmware. The process took almost a week. I would've given Sony 4 stars if they made it easier to update. I'm really disappointed and I hope they fix this in the future.

The ability to use it with other T-Series speakers is a nice feature. The only negative is the fact that the volume control is on the back of the unit and not on the front. This means that when you want to use the T101, you have to reach over and turn the volume knob on the side. That is not a big deal, but I'm sure that if it was on the left, it would be easier to reach.   a good addition to the sound system, and the T40 is a decent choice, too, though it is priced about the same.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I purchased a few days ago a Sennheiser HD 800 headphones (new condition) to use with my iphone. They sound great. The sound quality is much better than my old headphones and I'm happy with them. I can hear better and with less distortion than with my old iphones. The new headphones are nice. The build quality is great. I like the design. I also like the price. I bought them for $20 each and it's a great deal. The only thing I'm not a big fan of is the sound distortion on the lower treble. For those who don't know, the HD 800 is a headphone that is popular in the high end audiophile world. It's a very high quality headphone. This review will be a little lengthy because it's been awhile since I used a set of Sennhesier HD 800.  However, since I started my review I've become more familiar with the headphones and what they can do.  The headphones are available in 2 different versions, the SE version and the HF version.  The SE version comes in black with white trim and the RF version comes with black with red trim.  I'm going to show the differences in the ear pieces and cables that are on each headphone.  Here are the differences I found in the cable and ear piece: The SE version:  The cable is about 10 cm long.  It's black and a bit stiff but a lot more comfortable than the old ones.  There's a small piece of metal on the other end of the cable that helps it stay in place better.  As far as the earpieces go, the earpiece in the SE model is made of metal and is not as flexible as the ones in the HF models.  This makes the earpads in the HD version a lot stiffer.   I like how the ear pads fit on the ear cups but the RF model is more flexible than the SE one.  For the RF models the cable is the same length as the SE.  To wrap up the RF's, they are very comfortable and sound good.  If you're going to get these, I would recommend going for the RF versions because the ear piece in the RF are not as stiff as the one in the normal SE model.   The HF version:   The ear pieces are made of plastic and are a lot thinner than the ones used in the regular SE

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: *********** I just got my Sony Vaio VGN-Z800. I figured the Vaio would be no different. The player itself is very light, and easy to handle. It has a nice feel to it, and doesn't get too hot in use. I did have to return it a couple times because the cable would break (the plastic that comes with it breaks very easily). I was surprised to see that the player came with two pairs of headphones. I bought this because I needed a device that was portable, and I needed to listen to music at a reasonable volume. But I had to use my Sony players on a regular basis, so I couldn't really give this device the full review that I wanted to give it. For $200, I'm glad I got it, but I wouldn't recommend it. It does the job, but it isn't the best player out there.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: __________ I use the MSP430 as a simple microcontroller for a little hobby project that uses an Arduino Mega for communication and I got my board at a great price from AliExpress. It was very easy to set up and was easy to program. The only negative is that the board has a little bit of noise when the chip is powered up. The chip has the same frequency as the PIC microcontroller but has a lower clock rate. So, it takes about 3 seconds for the clock to go to the same speed as the microcontroller. The PIC is also very noisy. I am not sure if it is a design or a problem with the chip. I hope it can be corrected in the next version of the board.  Noise when it's powered on? - July 21, 2016 - July 20, 2016 Anonymous Reviewed By: This is a very good and easy to use board for your prototyping. It has lots of power options including 5V and 2.5V. The most interesting is the addition of an ADC that you can connect to the pins of your microcontroller to measure the voltage. This is very handy as it is very easy and inexpensive to create a microcontroller using a PIC.  for a small project that is powered by a micro controller the price is unbeatable  good chip, but the board needs a good power source  I use it for a project where I need a very small chip with low power. The chips that come on the board are the most popular ones but there are also chips with a better price.  " I use it to control my Arduino-like board that I have. I need to be able to get information about the temperature. I can use the pins as analog inputs. I use a LM35 that has a voltage divider so I need 2V. This means I need 3V to power the Arduino and 1V to feed the chip to the LM35. It seems that the chip has problems on 5V. I have a problem on 5.5-6.0V and the other pins work fine. The LM35 I bought at Adafruit seems to work fine on 5-6V. But I would buy another one if I needed a 5V one.  a better solution would be to use a chip that has an ADC. I was able to make a very cheap ADC with an FT232RL that I can feed to the PIR sensor and get

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ****************** I bought the A4 version of the ZTE Zmax and was pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the build quality. It is very comfortable to hold, has a large enough display to watch movies on without looking like a giant tablet, and has a great keyboard. The camera is decent, and is one of the better ones out there for the price. I've only had the phone for a couple weeks so can't comment on the battery life, but I have yet to have to charge it more than a couple times. The one thing I did notice was that the Zmax has a very noticeable blue tint when you are watching movies. It really shows up and makes the colors look a little washed out. I think it's going to be very difficult to get used to this, but if you can adjust your settings to get rid of it you will be very happy.  Rated 5 out of 5 by Gail from Great phone, great battery I've had the ZMAX for about a week and I am extremely happy with the phone. I am not an Android fan, but this phone is extremely user friendly. I like that it comes with the stock browser and Google apps, plus the phone is not too heavy. It does not feel cheap at all. I have not had to use it a lot yet, but it is very quick to get up and running. I love that the screen is clear and bright, and the camera is very good. The only thing I am upset about is the battery, which is very small. This will be my last phone purchase from ZTE. I would like to see them come out with a larger battery, and I hope the screen and camera are better next year. Overall, I love the phone and I would recommend it.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- I purchased a Sennheiser HD 800 and a Sangean SR800, but I was not happy with the sound. I've heard many headphones that I really enjoy and really like their sound quality. I was extremely happy with these two headphones. The bass is great, but not overwhelming and the treble is pretty neutral. The sound is very detailed and has great clarity. The treble and bass have a slight emphasis on the upper midrange and bass. The high end of the headphone is great and is quite forward, but does not overwhelm the mid-bass and sub bass. I use this headphones for gaming, listening to music, watching movies and listening to podcasts. This headphone is a perfect fit for me, I can go to my office and have a conversation while I play a video game. I will probably not be buying another headphone like these, but will continue to use this type of headphone.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    I have been using a sony DSC-F550A (a very good piece of gear, I use it on my work computer and it works just as well as my desktop computer) and I was looking for a good little DAC for portable use. I was also trying to decide between the AD700 and the SONY DT-990, which both are very good, but the DT-991 has an excellent build quality and is a better sounding device in my opinion.   Well I have been waiting for a new version of the DSC and when it came I was VERY pleased. The DSC has been improved with better digital to analog converters, a better noise gate, better noise floor, better digital/analog phase adjustment, a bit more output power, more headphone output (1/8th inch plug) and a more convenient USB port. The DAC has an LED for volume level, and an LED that turns on when you start playback.   a bit bigger than the DT990, but that is to be expected. The sound is great, with very good clarity and very clear highs. The only thing that can be improved is the low end. This DAC is great for most users. If you are an audiophile you should be happy with the quality of the sound.     It does not have a headphone jack, but there is a mini to headphone output that will connect to any headphone jack. It has a built in mic, and a 1/8 jack input.  :)

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- This is my first keyboard. I bought this because my old keyboard was broken and my daughter wanted something to do with her hand. I had a lot of trouble with my old one so this one was very easy to install. The key caps are made out of nice metal and are a little thinner than the ones from a regular computer. The only thing I have to say about the layout is the function keys are a lot more difficult to use than the numbers keys. The function keys for the backspace key are on the top row. The one row above them has a lot less keys than the back row keys so it's hard to tell what you're pressing. The numeric keypad is a little larger than the one on my other computer, so you can only use a couple keys at a time to make up for the space. It takes a while to figure out what the numbers on the keypad are for so I don't use it much. I've had this for a couple of weeks and it's great. It's not as easy to type on as the IBM Model M, but it's still pretty nice and you can type just fine. Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ------------ This is my first time buying an iPad, but I was surprised that I liked it. The display is crisp, and it is not heavy, so it's easy to carry around. The iPad has many good features: it's a really good camera (the pictures I took with it are worth the price of the tablet), it has many features that make it easier to use than a laptop (it's small, so you don't have to lug a laptop around, and the screen is easy to read), and it can easily sync with your other devices. I can't really complain about anything else: it just works. I like that it's not a "big" device, but it's nice to have a smaller one. I haven't tried to buy the bigger iPad, because it's so expensive, but the iPad Mini seems to be the way to go for me. I'll be buying another one to give to my parents when they get older. I hope that they like it too! I have a Macbook Pro, but since the iPad is smaller and lighter, I don't think I'd buy it.

I love them, but have recently grown weary of the fact that they get so much noise from my computer and the air conditioning in my apartment. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  The AVR-S9x is a very good, high quality module that you can't really get anywhere else. I have a lot of analog modules and they all have one big issue, noise. The AVR was designed with the idea of having a little noise to add to the signal to add a little extra noise to the analog. If you are using an AVR for your audio, this is a must have for you.  I use mine on my Roland SH101 which has a 4-track recorder so I have the flexibility of using both AVR's on one unit.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I bought this amp because it's advertised as a preamplifier, but the manual and reviews I've read say that the amp doesn't really do this. I did have a few problems, but overall I am satisfied.  The first problem was that the cable was not properly sized.  The amplifier has a 5 pin input connector and a 1/4" input jack.   The cable is too short to fit the input jack correctly.  Also the 1/2" output jack on the amplifier was bent and the connector was loose on the jack. The second problem is that it does not fit the 5 pin connector correctly. The input jack is a bit short.  I have used a jack with a 1 1/8" plug that fit perfectly.  A 1/3" cable would have been a better fit for the jack on this unit.  Overall I would have preferred a more robust cable and I will return it to be exchanged.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:!!! This is the best device ive ever used, im a musician who needs to have a small laptop but dont want to sacrifice too much sound quality. The sound is amazing, its clear as hell, no crackles, and the keys are the exact right size and shape. the only thing that would be better is if the screen was a little bigger, but that's just a minor complaint. I have a laptop pro that sounds like a CD player but the screen is way too small, and not at all easy to read. It would be great if they made the screen bigger, and included a usb cord so you can plug it into your PC. The only thing is that the usb cord is so short that its hard to plug it in if you are standing up and the keyboard is on your lap. The best part is that you can use the usb connection to connect your phone to the keyboard and your phone/tablet will be on at the same time. If you're a musician and you want a great sounding computer without breaking the bank, look no further than this one. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I'm not sure if I'd go with this as a daily driver. It's got all the basic features that a good portable DAC is expected to have and it is pretty good for the price. I really like the fact that it's USB-C and has an onboard DAC. You can use it to play all the latest releases on your computer or use the built-in DAC to convert your MP3s and listen to them on a portable device like this. It is a little hard to get the balance right with this DAC and you will likely be needing to turn the volume down a bit to get a good signal. However, this is one of the best portable DACs that I have used and I recommend it to anyone who wants to go portable. Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------------------- My first "real" synthesizer, it's nice to be able to control it with my feet, it sounds good, it feels nice and sturdy, very nice. The only problem is that it's very loud, so you will need a big room. But it's worth it, I highly recommend it. I was thinking about getting a modular synthesizer to replace it, but I'm glad I got this instead. The modular has its own personality though, it has a very "organic" sound, I like it a lot more. I'd recommend it for a beginner, or a person who is just beginning with electronic music. I got it in a bundle with the Analog Man VHS module, and the Korg Volca Bass 2. I highly suggest the Analogman VHS if you're looking for a solid synth with a more "organic feel" I don't own it yet, but the Volca BASS 2 is a good choice for a second VHS (the Korg one is great though, and I've had both). Pros: - great sounds, can sound like anything, with many different sounds you can find with it - great for beginners, it doesn't require too much learning - very loud (so you need a large space to play it) - very easy to use - lots of preset, can make a lot of sounds easily Cons: - some people have complained about the sound - there are no knobs or faders, you need to do all the work yourself (just plug in the cables, turn the knobs, use the faders) - no sequencer, so no MIDI - the battery is very small - you need the VHS to play the synthesizer - some complain about the battery life - it's not as flexible as a modular synth, the modules are not interchangeable (the modules can only be bought individually) - it can't be plugged into a computer, but there are USB and MIDI connections, which are useful - the price is a bit too high for a first synthesizer -------------- 5 out of 5: I just got mine a few days ago, and so far it's pretty much everything I hoped for and more. I bought it because it's a great way to learn and play around with synthesis, without having to spend a fortune. I have the KORG Volca

The wireless connection works great and the battery lasts a long time so you can play long periods of time without worrying about it dying. Also, this version has two batteries so you only need one when you need it. I also like that the battery compartment is a little larger than other gamepads and that the USB cable has a longer extension so you don't have to carry the battery in your pocket. Overall I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for the best portable gamepad out there. I was disappointed in the Gamepad 2 because the wireless connection didn't work right and it did not have two batteries. I'm happy with this purchase and will purchase another for my kids. The unit is small and lightweight, which is a plus in the home environment. The TPLINK also includes a 5.8GHz USB adapter. The USB adapter is useful because it can act as a wireless access point in case your wireless router is on a different frequency. The 5.4GHz adapter is great if you have a lot of computers that use a lot more bandwidth than the Dlink router.

This has been a favorite for me. The key placement feels good, and it is very nice to use. This model comes with a decent set of features: The keycaps are a nice medium blue, and there is a nice silver logo on the back of the keyboard. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   I was looking for a wireless microphone that had good audio quality, that was portable, and that would work with any device. This mic is great, and very easy to use. The only negative I can say about this mic is that it does not seem to work with a lot of devices that I own. I have a small iPod Touch, an iPod Nano, and a small iPhone 4S. The mic will work with all of them, but if the audio gets distorted, it sounds like it is on a defective device. Other than that, I'm very happy with this mic!  Rated 4 out of 5 by Anonymous from It's a great product, but.... It's been quite a while since I've reviewed a product. So here's a short one. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I bought this about a year ago and I love it. I use it for my computer and it does the job perfectly. It does have a tendency to overheat but it is a good little tool. The only negative is that you have to be very careful when working on the wires and when you remove the case from the device.  Also, the case is very hard to open and close and it's not easy to remove the battery if you happen to have the battery in the case. A little expensive for the features, but I love the small size and the fact that the device has an LED light to indicate battery level, so I always know when the battery is low and when it's full. I have to say I was very surprised to find that the case was actually a little cheap, I thought the price would be a little higher.  Overall, I give it 4 stars and would buy it again if I ever need a backup.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ------------ A good product with a bad warranty. This is the only device I use for watching videos. I have a Samsung 55" TV with the latest firmware (4.4.2). I downloaded the video streamer software from this website and loaded it on the TV and connected it to my laptop using a USB cable. The only problem is that the device never started. The first time I tried to start it I got the following message: "Could not load the software. This software is not supported on this system." So I tried again but it still wouldn't start. So I thought to check on the manufacturer website. The message from the website said "Unfortunately, the software is only supported on a specific type of PC. We recommend you purchase a new video player." I decided to try again. I downloaded it again, downloaded the latest update from the manufacturer and started it. It worked! I was very surprised and was happy I tried it. So if you have a problem with your video player, buy this one.  X Previous image Next image  Verified purchase: Yes | Condition: new | Sold by: ejc_c

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I have had the original Sony Walkman for a while now, and I really like it. It's small, light, and compact, and it can hold a lot of music. I have not used the Walkman in a long time, but I am looking forward to getting it up to speed with my music collection. It can play some really good mp3 files, but it can also hold a good amount of music and is small enough to not take up much space in my bag. I don't know about you, but my music is a little eclectic, and a Walkman like this is a good way to get all of my music in one place. It's a good looking device, and while it's not the fastest I've ever used, I don.t see any reason to get a slower model.  The battery lasts forever, and the sound quality is top notch.  This Walkman is the best, period.  It's not just a good design, it's an amazing design.   I'm sure that you'll find some issues with the device, but the quality of the design and the quality and reliability of this Walkman will last forever.
Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------------------- I am a professional musician. I have used many electronic instruments but the Yamaha MT-20 is the only one that is not a toy. It is a very good and very musical instrument that produces the same sound with my professional setup. The sound is more realistic than the Yamaha TC-20. The volume and tone controls are very easy to use and to change the sound. The only thing I would like to have in the MT-40 is the option to store the sounds. The MT-30 has the sounds stored in the back. This means that if you lose the back of the MT20, the sounds are lost forever. You need to keep the back to play the sound again if you have to. Overall, I am very satisfied with the MT30 and I think I will purchase the MT40. I love the volume and sound of the Yamaha.  Rated 5 out of 5 by Anonymous from Excellent sound! Rated 4 out of 5 by Anonymous from A great piece of kit but a little tricky to set up The DSP1000 is an excellent piece of technology that makes a very good audio source. The interface is very easy to set-up and it works great with my Windows PC. The audio quality is excellent. However, when I tried to connect it to a second device, I found that the device I connected it to would not work. I found this very frustrating and the solution that I came up with is to remove the battery before I plug the DSP into the other device. This solved the problem but I have to use a different USB cable for that device now. Overall, the Dsp1000 is a great piece that I would highly recommend to anyone who is into audio or video work.

Yes No Thursday, January 02, 2011  It's a Good Camera  by Peter from Sacramento CA USA  Pros: Great picture quality, small size, good price, works well with iPhone  Cons: None  Review: I have used a number of digital cameras over the years, but this is my first digital SLR. I like the size, the built-in flash and the ability to do video and stills on the same body. I also like the price, and it is easy to use with the included manual controls. It takes photos on a single card, but I haven't tried the video yet. It also comes with a couple of adapters to use other film cameras (I'm using a Bolex adapter for my 35mm film camera). I've had it for about a month and it has been perfect. I use the flash to illuminate the background, and a small pocket flash on my keychain. I have the latest version of the iPhone app and have not found a better camera app than the one built in to the S100. I think it would be a good buy if the flash wasn't so cheap. :D  Other Thoughts: This is a nice camera. I'm looking forward to shooting with it, and to using it as a backup.  the flash on it is a bit too strong for my tastes though. I would use the light-sensor-less lens instead of the standard zoom-lens to save a bit of weight. I know there are some people who really like the lens, and I'm happy to say that I am one of them.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: __________ The Sound Blaster X7 is a great sounding gaming audio device. I've used many of these types of devices, and I have to say that this one has been my favorite for gaming. The bass is great and the mids are clear, but the highs are a little weak for my tastes. I have the X7 connected to a Windows PC via an audio adapter (Sound Blaster Z) and my Xbox 360. The sound is not too loud, but not too soft, which is perfect for a gaming headset. The microphone is good for voice chat, but it's not great for gaming and there is a slight echo that comes through when I talk. Overall, a great product.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  Great product and works perfectly No, I don't own a P5, but the P5C is really awesome. This is the best wireless charger I've seen. It's a little bit more expensive than the P4, but it's so much better. The power cord is longer (I bought the longer one, because my cable runs too long) and it's a bit more compact, too. The best thing about the P3 is that it has a USB-C port, and that makes it a lot better than the old model. I use my P3 to charge a Nexus 6, which has a special cable with the USB-A to USB-B adapter. I plugged the USB cable from the P2 into the USB port on the Nexus 6 and the charger was able to charge the phone. I would recommend this charger for anyone that wants a good wireless charger. No. The P5 is a really great charger, but I have to say that I am a bit disappointed with the quality of the cables. I'm going to buy another one, but this one is not worth the money. Review of the new P5 Wireless Charger I bought this charger as an upgrade from the original one that came with my P5. It does what it's supposed to do, and has the USB Type C port. But it's not the same as the original charger. This new one comes with a USB Type A cable. That's a shame, as it's easier to use the original cable for the Nexus, because the original Nexus doesn't have a USB type A port. I bought a new cable for my Nexus 6 that comes with it, so it's no longer a problem. The only thing is that I have two cables, one for my P2 and one for the P6. But I just don't like using two cables on my phone. Also, the cables are too short. I can't use my Nexus without a USB cable. So I'd rather have the longer cable with a type A connector. But if you buy the charger for the original P5 instead, you can use the cables with the Nexus.

Overall I'm happy with the purchase and highly recommend it.

The HP Pavilion is so small that it is easy to carry around and takes up very little space. I also use my HP dv3-5230p to browse the net and to listen to music. I like that the screen has a resolution of 800x600, but it is a little too bright for my taste. It is also rather slow. It takes a while to open and close the lid, and it takes a long time to open the case. The laptop is quite noisy but I find that I can make myself quiet by just using headphones. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:!!! I'm extremely pleased with my new Sennheiser HD 800 headphones, and it is my first pair of high-end headphones! I am a recording engineer and have been using the Shure SRH840 for a couple of years now, so these HD 800's are a lot more expensive than the SRH8xx's, but the sound quality is incredible and the soundstage is much better. I also have a Senn HD 800 with the same cable, but it has some very minor issues. I'm not sure if the differences are due to the cables used, or the different settings the HD 800/SRH8x use. Either way, the HD 8x sound great and are definitely worth the money, I would recommend them to anyone!

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I have to say this is the first set of headphones I've ever owned that I can truly say are amazing, and I've been a long time headphone fiend. I bought the Audeze LCD-2s for my girlfriend, she's been a big fan of the LCD-3, and so I'm a little surprised that she's not even more impressed with these. If you're looking for a quality set of portable headphones, these are for you! Good price, excellent sound, solid construction, great build quality, a little heavy, but well worth it, and a very nice looking pair of headphones.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:!!!! This device was my first time ordering a product from these guys. I've been using the wireless printer for about two years now, and I love it. My first purchase was from the website (as you may know they are very new to the e-commerce business). I did have to contact them for a shipping quote, but I think it was reasonable and they were very responsive to my questions and requests. Once my printer arrived, I did get the original print cartridge, but the company also sent me a replacement. I was able to print in color at a reasonable price point. The quality of the print is fantastic. I have the printer in a bedroom that is usually dark, and it prints beautifully. I can print on a very large surface. I think the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because of the limited color choices. However, I am a print designer, and the fact that I can use a variety of colors makes it very versatile. The only issue I had was the printer seemed to be having trouble with the paper I was using, which was the same brand that came with my printer. I had to go out and buy some new paper for my printer (which was expensive), and the printer was able print again. I hope this review helps someone else. I'll be ordering from them again!

I'm a bit concerned about this problem because it could lead to the system slowing down if I have lots of games running at once. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:............................................................. This is my 2nd G5. It was a gift for my brother who loves electronics. He has had other computers but I'm sure he'll get a G5 soon. The screen is bright and sharp. The keyboard is easy to type on and is very responsive. The battery life is great. I am using it for gaming and I can play for hours on a charge. The sound quality is very good. It has no problems with music or movies. The only thing I don't like is that there is no USB ports on the back of the computer. If you plan on using this for a larger screen like a 4k TV, you may need to purchase a usb to HDMI converter. The software is pretty basic. I wish there were more. I like the size of the machine but the keyboard and track pad feel too small. Overall a great computer for the price.

Yes No Tuesday, January 20, 2011  Excellent Product!  by Jeff from California  Review: I'm happy with the product. I used to carry around a battery powered CD player and I used it for many years. However, I noticed that the battery would last only an hour or two if I used all of it in one sitting. I found myself taking my battery out before the CD started playing, which is why I purchased the MP3 Player. The MP3 player is extremely well built and works flawlessly. The controls are well laid out and the volume dial is intuitive. The batteries are a little on the small side, but I've had my iPod for years, and it's always had some capacity left. It fits in my pocket, and is very easy to charge. It also has a small built in stand. I've seen other reviewers complain about the lack of memory, but the MPD 3 supports up to 96 hours of continuous music playback.  I've been very pleased with this product and recommend it highly. The sound quality is very good for a small electronic guitar. I have a couple of the MDRs that I've owned for the last 7 years. I use the electric guitar mostly when I'm home with my son, but I've also used the MDS and the MDM for the same purpose. I love both of these instruments, and I've tried a couple other similar brands. I find that these are a better value and quality than the more expensive brands. It's a nice little tool. Overall, I am very satisfied with the MDA. I am able to use it on all of my instruments and am very pleased with the quality of sound. I also like the fact you can use it with different string gauges. I haven't had any problems with the unit, and it is easy to use and tune. I would recommend this to anyone. I found that the MDB and MDA fit the bill, and are all I need to play a small acoustic guitar. The MDA is a little louder than I'd like, but it doesn't take up much room in my case and I have no problem fitting a couple in there. I like the ability to control the level and volume with the included

It is very compact and sleek, and feels really high quality, especially when you hold it. The only problem i found with it was the battery life is a little short. However, if you are an audio person, it is an amazing device. It has a good quality sound, and it has a very good bass sound. This device is also pretty easy to use, with it's quick setup. The sound quality is also good. The volume is also adjustable. It doesn't have many settings, but it's pretty nice. This is one of the best devices I have ever used, and i can recommend it to anyone. ------------ What I like: ------------- The main feature of the phone is the great battery life. The phone is really portable and lightweight, which is really nice. The camera is also great, and the built in speaker is pretty loud. The voice recognition works really well, and has a really good quality. The design is very stylish and well made. I also like the quick setup and battery life, and that it comes with a USB cable, which makes it super convenient to use. The battery life of the device is about 3-4 hours. ------------- What I don't like: ----------- The only negative i found about the phone was the lack of a removable battery. I really like to use my battery as a backup. The removable battery does not have a good feature, so I wish that they added one. -------------- Conclusion: --------------- I'm really satisfied with this phone, but if you want a really lightweight and portable phone, then the Galaxy S II is definitely the way to go. The one thing that I did not like about this phone was that it doesn't come with a removable removable battery, which I really wanted.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    The best way to describe the sound quality of the Hsu M2 is a combination of analog and digital, with a bit of the old analog to digital and a bit more digital. The M2 has a very nice, full and rich sound, and I love the analog EQ. It's easy to turn up and down without being intrusive. I have the analog output and use my soundcards, but the digital output is so much nicer. I recommend the M2 to everyone.  I've had the M-1 for a couple of years and have gotten used to the sounds it provides, but I finally decided to get the M1, mainly because I really wanted to get a decent digital/analog converter for my M-2.   I'm pretty happy with my choice and can't wait to start using the M3. I'm also really glad to have this converter because I'll have two mics, so I can record both my main and the main monitor.  -L.W.    Product Rating: 5 out of 5-stars.

If you're planning on using a USB-M adapter, then the USB-B adapter is going to be the only option.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    Very cool and easy to use. Works as advertised and looks cool too. Great for my first airbrush kit and looks awesome on my build.  I recommend it to anyone who has an interest in airbrushing, especially if they are just getting into the hobby.  and...I just had the kit and it looks awesome!   I've had several different brands of airbrushes and they all felt cheap and had too much plastic in them. Not this one! I'm impressed with how well it holds paint. The brush is nice and firm and is a perfect length for my short arms (and you don't need to get much bigger than this to get a good paint job out of it).  It does take some time to get the hang of the controls, but it gets better with practice. Once you get the controls down, the controls feel smooth and accurate. The handle is easy to grip and the airbrush is nice to hold.   If you're into airbrushed models and don't have a lot of money, this is a great starter kit! It's well built and very easy to put together.  , but for the price, it's not worth it. It's a fun kit to build, but the airbrusher doesn't have that much power and the price is just way too high for a beginner. I would not recommend this airbrush to someone who is just getting started in airbrush painting and just wants something good enough to start them off.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    The new A.C.E. (Advanced Circuits Electronic Starter Kit) is the best kit on the market for the price. The kit is built in a small unit that fits on your keychain and is easy to use. It comes with everything you need to start building and debugging circuits, including a breadboard, two resistors, two capacitors, a potentiometer, and two test leads. The A.E has a built-in USB port for connecting to a PC to transfer files, and the software comes with many examples and programs to help you get started. I have been using this for the last few months and the build quality is excellent, the parts are all included and the package is extremely well designed.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: -------------------------- I bought the Korg K-1000 a few years ago. I've used the K-800 and the K1 as my primary synthesizer since then, and I like all of them. The K-100 is very different from the others. It's much smaller, and it's got some great sounds, but the keyboard is terrible. I love the K3, but I'm not sure it's a good choice for someone who wants a synthesizer with a keyboard. The controls are well designed, but that's about it. The sound is a bit thin, and the oscillators sound more like a square wave than a sine wave. The only thing that keeps me from giving it a 5 star rating is the fact that it has no tuner, and is pretty much unusable for that reason. If you're in the market for a small, easy to use, cheap to buy synth, go for the K100. If the sound quality is good, that's all that matters. But if you want a synthesiser with a good keyboard, get the K1000, which is what I did.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  This is an excellent tool for students with dyslexia, because it is an alphabetical system. It has many symbols that are easy to learn, but the "sound" of the letter is what makes the difference. If you can get a good teacher to use this alphabet, you can learn it faster and more accurately than the printed alphabet. The only drawback is that this only has a single symbol for each letter (and it has an extra one to add). If I had to use an all-in-one tool for dyslexic students, this is what I would use. I do not think there is a better system for dyslectic students than this one. I would not suggest this to a dyslexics if they have difficulty learning English. The spelling is a little off, but it does not have to be the key to learning.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ------------I have had the same Samsung e-reader since May 2008. This is my first electronic device (e-book reader) and I am quite impressed with it. The screen is very good, I like the contrast between the white and the black. I love the way the book is laid out, it has many options for different reading experiences. The pages flip over nicely and there is very little friction. The back light is great, it is bright, but not too bright (not that bright) and it does not glare. The only thing I would like to see is more page turning options, the only way to turn the pages in my opinion is to turn your head to turn. Overall, I love this device, very happy with my purchase and I have a feeling that I will be getting a couple more for my friends and family.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  The Sony SmartWatch 2 is a good product and I'm very happy with it. It's waterproof, waterproof, and waterproof. It doesn't get hot or sweaty in the summer and doesn't take a lot of abuse. I haven't found anything that doesn't work perfectly well, and it can sync up to my cell phone as well as the watch itself. If I'm ever bored, I can just get my watch to show me the time, or I can use it to make phone calls or even play music from my phone. The smartwatch is also fairly accurate, and when I say accurately I mean it can keep up with my pace. I was a little worried about how much battery life the watch would have but it lasted me about 5 days and it still has about 4 days left. So if you need a smartwatch for a while you'll probably get some use out of it. I also like that it's wireless and that the watch has a microphone which is nice when you're talking to someone. I only have one small complaint about the watch and that is that the button on the back of the watch is really small. I'd rather have the buttons on the sides of the wrist, which means I'd have to get a new watch. If you have a Sony Smartwatch you should really check it out.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- This is a very nice, inexpensive, compact, and quiet speaker. The sound is clear and is very bass-heavy, which is what I want in my speakers. My only complaint is that the remote is a little awkward to use. However, I did find a better remote with the same specifications for $20 more.  Style of Music: ------------- I've been looking for a decent, bass-centric set of speakers for my home theater. This one does exactly that! Bass is well-rounded, and the mid/high range is just right. I had some other speakers in my system that were bass-biased, but this speaker does an excellent job of filling the room with well-balanced sound. The bass is smooth, without being boomy, and it sounds very natural. The mid/top end is also well-done. I'm a big fan of the quality of these speakers. They are a great value and are a big improvement over the stock speakers I have in my HT. If you are looking for something in the $30-$40 price range that will work well in your HT, look no further.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- I have owned this product for a few months now. It is well built and works perfectly. I have bought the same model for several years, so I know it's not going to break, but this is my first attempt at repairing my own electronic device. I've used a soldering iron to solder in place the two contacts on the battery cable (the two wires that attach the battery to the device) that I believe have come loose. The battery cable is very easy to install on the device (only two wires, just pull straight out). The device is now charging and running perfectly. The only negative is that the battery itself is pretty heavy. I am not sure if the original design of the charger used a heavy battery and/or that the heavy battery is being replaced, or what. But the battery is very heavy and will be hard to get to the bottom of the device. That said, I have had the same battery for many years. I would buy this product again, only with thicker wires and a thicker battery.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: ------------------------- -------------------------- The Sony A6300 has all the features I've been looking for in a modern point and shoot: excellent quality for the price, great features, good size, easy to use, and a few other small extras. The A6330 has some nice improvements over the A6301, such as the flash sync button and the ability to sync to a PC. The size and weight of the A6500 is more than acceptable for a point andshoot, but the lack of a flash sync can be a big drawback. The lack of manual controls, especially for flash sync, is also a big deal. The built in flash is fine, but I think I would rather have a flash trigger. The Sony camera has some built in features, including a video mode that lets you shoot video without a memory card. This is great if you're using the camera for video, but it can be very confusing when you have to do something different with the camera when you want to take a picture. Overall, this is a great camera for the money.

I have a pair of Sony MDR-100s that I use in my car and this beats them both hands down. The noise cancelling is a huge plus as it makes my car commute so much less of a nightmare. The bass is great and the mids are rich and smooth. The highs are crisp and the highs on the MDR100s are too recessed. This is not the case with the 3 or the 4. I'm still on the fence with the M-100 but the 3s sound great to me and I would definitely recommend this over the M100 if I were to get a new set.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: --------------- I purchased the 3d Printer from my local store on Friday evening. The store called me back on Monday morning to tell me they had shipped it out that day. I had ordered a 3d printer from them before and I've been very happy with the quality of their products. This printer looks like a big lump of plastic. The print bed is huge and is filled with layers. The design is nice and it's got a good amount of support. The first prints were not as good as I had hoped. I printed with a single nozzle and was not able to get a good smooth finish. The plastic was still slightly brittle and had a little play. The prints came out nice, but they were still not as nice as a good desktop 3d print. I ordered the printer again to try to improve the print quality. This time I printed the top layer on the bed with no support, then I printed on the bottom layer with support. It took a little longer to print with the top and bottom layers printed together, but I was able to print a better finish. I am very happy to have purchased the printer. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to purchase one.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I've used this to record my guitar lessons for the last several years and have been very pleased. It's got a nice low noise floor and has a nice wide dynamic range. This has a good microphone input (I use the onboard mic on my Zoom H2n). It's a lot more compact than the Zoom H1n. I have been using the Zoom as my main recorder for several years. I find the H2 to be a great value. I like the large, comfortable carrying case, but would love to see a better screen for the backlit LCD display. The H2 has a little more gain for the input. If you want to save some money, get the Zoom and save yourself some time. It has a better input and I would have preferred a few more inputs.  The H2 is an excellent recorder and it has a very clear LCD display with a very wide dynamic response. I highly recommend it.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I bought this because my old analog cassette player is giving up the ghost. I've been using my digital player on and off for years, but the digital player has a bad habit of getting hot and/or losing the data on the disc. This is much better and is able to hold my favorite songs for a long time. I like the built-in CD player and the headphone jack. It's great to be able to keep all the data I want on the device and then have the option of listening to it later. The speakers are OK, but not great, and the battery is not great. It lasts about 6 hours, but that is a lot for my old CD player. The battery life is about the same as the analog cassette I had before, so I can't complain too much. But I'm not a fan of the fact that it's so small. It has to be in your pocket and you have to carry it around.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:     This is an excellent piece of equipment for my needs. I use the SONY DVD-R player as my main source of entertainment and audio. I have an iMac running OS X and a DVD-RW drive that I use for storing my digital media. The USB drive is a nice touch. I don't use the DVD-ROM drive anymore. The player has plenty of power and I have no complaints about the operation. The only thing I would like to see is a volume control so that I could select the right bitrate for my movies. The device is a bit of a pain to set up and use. The instructions on how to configure the device are lacking. The setup is simple enough for me but I wish I had a bit more information on how it works so that it is easier to set it up. The unit itself is small and I'm very happy with the performance. The sound is great. I haven't heard anything like it. I will definitely be using this product for years to come. I would recommend this device to a friend. I recommend this product to anyone who wants a good digital player and good sound. I am very happy that I bought this player. It is a great deal. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I'm so happy I purchased the Pico Pico Pro from Adafruit. The Pico is an Arduino powered device that has the same form factor as an Arduino and the same functionality as an AVR. I've had a few of the PICOs already so I knew that they were pretty cheap. The quality of the board is good. The AVR is very easy to program and has a large library. The only real down side is that you need a USB connection for programming. Otherwise, it is a great board for beginners and advanced users alike. It's very easy and simple to program the PICOM. I will be recommending this to my friends and family.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I bought a refurbished Sony CD player for $75. I wanted to be able to play my favorite old vinyl records, and this little guy works like a charm. It's very quiet, and it has an optical sound card that will make your records sound much better. It is a good value for the money. This is a pretty decent quality player. It has a built-in CD changer which I found very useful. The buttons on the player are very responsive and are easy to use. It also has a 2-inch LCD screen, which is great. The only problem I have is that there is no way to set the speed. The unit does not have an on-off switch and you have to turn it on manually. Great player, but I would like it to have an option for speed control. The volume control on the CD player does not work as a level control. I'm used to a player with a speed control for volume. Excellent product. The CD player has excellent sound quality. I bought it because I can't find an optical drive on my computer. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:  I purchased a ZX Spectrum with the intention of getting an MP3 player for my son. I was initially hesitant about the price, but the package was very well packaged and the product was exactly what I was looking for. I am very pleased with my purchase. I have a Zilog ZX-10 which I have had for several years. I got the 1040, and have been using it a lot. The sound quality is good and the sound is crisp. I've had this with a couple of different software programs and it has been working perfectly. The ZX's are the best sounding computers I have ever had, bar none. I also have a Spectrum Plus which I use for games and the Sound Blaster II. The Sound Blaster sounds better than the Spectrum Plus and I love the fact that it's a standalone unit. My only complaint is that the ZX has a shorter battery life than the others in the series, but I can live with that. I'm happy to have the extra functionality of a sound board, and it works well with the other computers. Excellent, and at a very reasonable price.  It is a shame that the old, expensive sound chips used on the Z80, and the Amstrad CPC, did not get a modern upgrade, because their sound quality was absolutely excellent.   I bought a new Spectrum Plus because I wanted to play some old games (like "Sid Meier's Civilization") on my ZX (the old system didn't have the original game ROMs) and the Spectrum's sound is great.  The Z80 was the best computer ever made, period.

Good quality and value:!!!!I've used my BCD600 on a few different systems and I've been very satisfied with both the quality and the value. The price and quality is well worth the money. I'm very happy that I got it for such a good price.  Great for the price:!!!!!The BCD500 is a great little board for a few bucks! It will do the job for most of what I need.  in a small footprint: !!!!This is a nice little board. I installed it on a 4GB SD card, it works just as well as the BCD5100 that I've had for over a year. The small size is perfect for the small footprint that I have in my car. The board is easy to put together, but does have a few parts that need to be soldered to the board, but they are easy to do. The solder joints on the board are not perfectly round, but if you do not mind that they are still easy to work with. In conclusion:!!!!!!!!!!!!This was a great deal, especially if you are considering getting an SD card reader. It is very compact, very simple to use and is very easy to install. The only complaint I have about this product is that there are no USB ports on the side, but you can use a USB keyboard. Bought it for a small child. Easy to use.

Write a positive review about a good electronic device:   The new DSP-L-100 has excellent features. I was looking for a digital compressor with good analog style filters. This unit is great for that and a lot more. The unit has the "D" in it, so I was thinking of a digital to analog converter. But it really doesn't take an analog converter to have a great compressor. I think the "E" is the analog mode and it is nice to have that "L" on the label. I use a couple of different compressors but this is my go-to compressor.   Was this review helpful to you?

Write a positive review about a good electronic device: __________ My iDevice 5c has been a great purchase. The touch screen is easy to use, and is accurate. I was initially concerned that it was a cheap product because the manufacturer didn't mention the cost in the description. But, the company sent me a prepaid shipping label for the item, which is a plus. The screen is very bright and crisp. The volume controls are easy to operate, and the speakers are very loud. It's a very quiet unit and you get a good amount of headroom. The remote is very good too. I haven't had a chance to compare it to the DPA 100 but I have been using this unit for about a month. I have tried it on both my Yamaha HS-15 (DPA 100) and my KEF LS70. The HS-5 is definitely my favorite out of the two. This unit is also more compact than the 100, which is good because you can get a lot of room for your music on the smaller unit. It is not as heavy or as big as the 100 but for the price you can't go wrong with either unit. I'm giving it 4 stars just because the DAP's sound really different than the DSP units. The DPA is a lot more bass heavy than the other units and the sound can be a bit tinny and thin. The LS70 is a little better than the others but still the best of the lot in my opinion.

They're also good for TV listening, too. ,  The one thing I would change is that it's not waterproof. I put a couple of my clothes in it, and it still worked, but the next day I went outside and it was raining. If it was waterproof, I could've put my clothes back in it and not had to wash the clothes, but since it isn't waterproof, the clothes get wet. Write a positive review about a good electronic device:    I just purchased this product on January 12, 2013. The first night I used it, I used a 2.1 amp cord (that is rated at 3 amps) to power it. However, after a few days I noticed a loss of sound. After a day or two of looking around, I discovered that my amp had died. I contacted customer service. I got a call back in a few hours. The guy I spoke with told me to use a lower amp and the device would work fine. I did this and I have been using it for about 3 weeks now. The sound is great! I'm a music lover, and it works great with my iPod, etc. I will be recommending it to all of my friends.

I bought these so I could have my Sony's sound quality on the go. These headphones are well built and are comfortable. They have a nice deep bass sound and I have yet to find a headphone that has the bass and depth of these. I also love the adjustable, detachable microphone. I really like the sound quality. The only negative thing I can say about these headphones is the noise canceling feature. I'm not sure if I like it or not, but I am definitely not a fan. They do work well for the noise cancellation, but the noise is still there. I just don't like the extra effort to get the sound that I want.
